item.title: Stones all over the road, 9th February
item.description:
Stones all over the top of the slip road making it difficult to pull out onto the North Cray Road and for prams or wheelchair users crossing that part of the road, they are also on the pavement

item.title: Fly tipping, 9th February
item.description:

item.title: Graffiti tag on electric box in Maddox close/bedens Road, 9th February
item.description:
Graffiti on the electric box. I have cleaned the front with bleach as it was about my daughter but can you remove stupid little tag of graffiti artists. If you are able to advise on any next steps for you to view cctv as this is the second lot of graffiti about my 11 year old by these two children.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maddocks Close, North Cray, Greater London

item.title: Big hole dug no one there post box gone, 9th February
item.description:
There was a royal mail box there. They removed it by big hole they have dug up. In Salters Rd near Globe Pond Rd, I hope they put mail box back as thats only one close to where we live..I have seen no one at site for days completing job either. They dig holes and then leave them. The post box was right by hole before was removed..
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Buckters Rents, Rotherhithe, Greater London

item.title: New green areas damaged with pedestrian work, 9th February
item.description:
Really sad to see that the new green areas on the road have been used for storing stones while making the new pavement on lordship park. Plants just got planted and now damaged.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lordship Park, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 110 Frognal, 9th February
item.description:
This abandoned Forest bike has been left since the weekend and is dangerously lying on the pavement forcing pedestrians on to a busy and narrow road . This is irresponsible and needs to be sorted immediately and monitored by Forest . Alternatively , the bike will be disposed of. An elderly person fell as a result of this selfish lazy parking of yous undocked bike .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frognal, South Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter not removed from football field, 9th February
item.description:
I walk my dog regularly over the back field of Hall Place and have noticed the last few weeks after the weekend that the footballers using this field are leaving alot of rubbish ie water bottles and alot of plastic tabs. This is really dangerous for all the wildlife over the field especially the dogs running around. My dog picked up one of the tabs and I had to get it off her. If my dog was to swallow this, it would have killed her. Please can something be done about this. I have been advised by other users of the park the footballers use these tabs to secure the bets on the goals. The people in charge of using these fields to play football need to be warned to remove all litter. It's so lazy of them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): FP125, Coldblow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
